events.title: Edict of Thessalonica issued
events.description: Emperor Theodosius I, along with Gratian and Valentinian II, issued the Edict of Thessalonica, declaring Nicene Christianity the state religion of the Roman Empire.
events.significance: This edict was a pivotal moment in the establishment of Christianity as the dominant religion in Europe, shaping religious and political landscapes for centuries.

events.title: Henry IV crowned King of France
events.description: Henry IV was crowned king in the Cathedral of Chartres, marking the beginning of the Bourbon dynasty's rule over France.
events.significance: Henry IV's reign helped to restore stability to France after the Wars of Religion, leading to major reforms and the eventual rise of France as a European power.

events.title: Reichstag Fire occurs in Germany
events.description: The German parliament building (Reichstag) was set on fire, an event used by the Nazi Party to justify the suspension of civil liberties and consolidate power.
events.significance: The Reichstag Fire was a critical event that enabled Adolf Hitler to establish a totalitarian regime, leading to World War II and the Holocaust.

events.title: The Warsaw Pact officially disbands
events.description: The military alliance of communist states led by the Soviet Union was officially dissolved, marking the end of Cold War military alignments in Eastern Europe.
events.significance: The disbandment symbolized the end of the Cold War era and the collapse of Soviet influence in Eastern Europe, paving the way for new political dynamics.
